content:
TITLE: Adding Bugsnag to Laravel 5.6 Logging Stack (PHP)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to add Bugsnag to the logging stack in 'config/logging.php' for Laravel 5.6. It demonstrates adding Bugsnag to the stack channels and creating a dedicated Bugsnag logging channel.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bugsnag/bugsnag-laravel.git/blob/master/UPGRADING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
    'channels' => [
        'stack' => [
            'driver' => 'stack',
            // Add bugsnag to the stack:
            'channels' => ['single', 'bugsnag'],
        ],

        // ...

        // Create a bugsnag logging channel:
        'bugsnag' => [
            'driver' => 'bugsnag',
        ],
    ],
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Removing Bugsnag Logging Integration in Laravel 5.6 (PHP)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to remove the existing Bugsnag logging integration from the 'register' method of 'app/Providers/AppServiceProvider.php' when upgrading to Laravel 5.6. It removes the alias bindings for the Bugsnag logger.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bugsnag/bugsnag-laravel.git/blob/master/UPGRADING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: diff
CODE:
```
- $this->app->alias('bugsnag.logger', \Illuminate\Contracts\Logging\Log::class);
- $this->app->alias('bugsnag.logger', \Psr\Log\LoggerInterface::class);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Removing Bugsnag Multi-Logger Integration in Laravel 5.6 (PHP)
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to remove the Bugsnag multi-logger integration from the 'register' method of 'app/Providers/AppServiceProvider.php' when upgrading to Laravel 5.6. It removes the alias bindings for the Bugsnag multi-logger.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bugsnag/bugsnag-laravel.git/blob/master/UPGRADING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: diff
CODE:
```
- $this->app->alias('bugsnag.multi', \Illuminate\Contracts\Logging\Log::class);
- $this->app->alias('bugsnag.multi', \Psr\Log\LoggerInterface::class);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Executing Git Commands for Release in Bash
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the Git commands to commit changes, create a new version tag, and push both the commit and tag to the remote repository. It's part of the release process for the Bugsnag Laravel notifier.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bugsnag/bugsnag-laravel.git/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git commit -am v2.x.x
git tag v2.x.x
git push origin master && git push --tags
```

----------------------------------------

DESCRIPTION: Command to generate Laravel's application encryption key.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bugsnag/bugsnag-laravel.git/blob/master/example/laravel-7/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
php artisan key:generate
```

DESCRIPTION: Command to start a PHP development server on localhost port 8000, serving the application from the public directory to test the Bugsnag integration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bugsnag/bugsnag-laravel.git/blob/master/example/lumen-7/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
php -S localhost:8000 -t public/
```

TITLE: Setting Unrestricted Web Crawler Access in robots.txt
DESCRIPTION: This snippet configures the robots.txt file to allow all web crawlers unrestricted access to the entire website. It uses the wildcard user-agent and doesn't specify any disallowed paths.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bugsnag/bugsnag-laravel.git/blob/master/features/fixtures/laravel11/public/robots.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: robots.txt
CODE:
```
User-agent: *
Disallow:
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Open Web Crawler Access in robots.txt
DESCRIPTION: A standard robots.txt configuration that allows all user agents unrestricted access to the site. The empty Disallow directive indicates no restrictions are placed on any paths.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bugsnag/bugsnag-laravel.git/blob/master/features/fixtures/laravel12/public/robots.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: robots.txt
CODE:
```
User-agent: *
Disallow:
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Unrestricted Access for Web Crawlers in robots.txt
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines rules for web crawlers, allowing them to access all parts of the website. It uses the wildcard (*) to apply to all user agents and does not disallow any paths.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bugsnag/bugsnag-laravel.git/blob/master/features/fixtures/laravel51/public/robots.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
User-agent: *
Disallow:
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Search Engine Access with robots.txt
DESCRIPTION: This robots.txt configuration allows all user agents (search engines) to access all content on the site. It uses the standard robots.txt syntax with no disallow directives, effectively granting full access to web crawlers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bugsnag/bugsnag-laravel.git/blob/master/features/fixtures/laravel56/public/robots.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
User-agent: *
Disallow:
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Web Crawler Access in robots.txt
DESCRIPTION: A standard robots.txt configuration that allows all web crawlers (user-agents) complete access to the website by using an empty disallow directive.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bugsnag/bugsnag-laravel.git/blob/master/features/fixtures/laravel58/public/robots.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: robots.txt
CODE:
```
User-agent: *
Disallow:
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Unrestricted Web Crawler Access in robots.txt
DESCRIPTION: This configuration allows all web crawlers to access the entire site without restrictions. It uses the standard robots.txt syntax to define access rules.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bugsnag/bugsnag-laravel.git/blob/master/features/fixtures/laravel66/public/robots.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: robots.txt
CODE:
```
User-agent: *
Disallow:
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Web Crawler Access in robots.txt
DESCRIPTION: Basic robots.txt configuration that allows all user agents (*) to access all paths with no disallow rules.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bugsnag/bugsnag-laravel.git/blob/master/features/fixtures/laravel8/public/robots.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: robotstxt
CODE:
```
User-agent: *
Disallow:
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Open Web Crawler Access in robots.txt
DESCRIPTION: This robots.txt configuration allows all user agents (web crawlers) to access all content without restrictions. The file contains no disallow directives, effectively permitting complete indexing of the site.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bugsnag/bugsnag-laravel.git/blob/master/features/fixtures/laravel9/public/robots.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
User-agent: *
Disallow:
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Search Engine Access in robots.txt
DESCRIPTION: Basic robots.txt configuration that allows all user agents to access all resources. Uses standard robots.txt syntax to define crawler behavior.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bugsnag/bugsnag-laravel.git/blob/master/example/laravel-5.2/public/robots.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: robots.txt
CODE:
```
User-agent: *
Disallow:
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Unrestricted Web Crawler Access in robots.txt
DESCRIPTION: This robots.txt configuration permits all web crawlers (search engines and bots) to access all content on the site. The 'User-agent: *' directive targets all crawlers, and the empty 'Disallow:' directive indicates no paths are restricted.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bugsnag/bugsnag-laravel.git/blob/master/example/laravel-5.8/public/robots.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
User-agent: *
Disallow:
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Default Robot Access Rules
DESCRIPTION: Basic robots.txt directives that specify access rules for web crawlers. The configuration allows all user-agents unrestricted access to the site.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bugsnag/bugsnag-laravel.git/blob/master/example/laravel-6/public/robots.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: robotstxt
CODE:
```
User-agent: *
Disallow:
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Web Crawler Access with robots.txt
DESCRIPTION: A standard robots.txt configuration that allows all web crawlers (User-agent: *) to access all parts of the website. The empty Disallow directive indicates no restrictions are placed on crawlers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bugsnag/bugsnag-laravel.git/blob/master/example/laravel-7/public/robots.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
User-agent: *
Disallow:
```
